arts.ttl: The lowdown on Birmingham City 1 Charlton Athletic 0 - Off colour Addicks undone by Stansfield
arts.sum: Charlton Athletic: Maynard-Brewer (Mannion 45), Ramsay, Gillesphey, Jones, Edwards, Coventry (Leaburn 74), Campbell, Berry (Anderson 57), Docherty, Small (Kanu 57), Godden (Gilbert 74). Blues have the best defensive record in the third tier and handled all that Charlton were able to throw at them as they tried to push for a leveller.

arts.ttl: Nathan Jones provides view on Ashley Maynard-Brewer handball accusation at Birmingham
arts.sum: Charlton Athletic manager Nathan Jones revealed why goalkeeper Ashley Maynard-Brewer had to be withdrawn at the halfway point of the 1-0 loss at Birmingham City – and also gave his view on a contentious incident early on. Maynard-Brewer was perhaps lucky to escape without punishment after appearing to handle the ball outside of his area in the early stages.

arts.ttl: Nathan Jones accuses Birmingham City of 'something-housery' after Charlton defeat
arts.sum: Nathan Jones has accused Birmingham City of ‘something-housery’ after Jay Stansfield ended Charlton Athletic’s six-game unbeaten run. Nathan Jones accuses Birmingham City of'something-housery' after Charlton defeat

arts.ttl: Chris Davies gives nod to Tom Brady for helping Birmingham City ace ‘in great form’
arts.sum: Birmingham City investor Tom Brady has played his part in helping Ethan Laird reach new heights this season “He’s had to earn it and work for it because there was a time when it wasn’t going that way this season and that’s a great story for all the players.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies highlights what Jay Stansfield did before Birmingham City stunner
arts.sum: Chris Davies highlighted Jay Stansfield’s ‘work ethic, tenacity and desire’ to win the ball back before unleashing a beauty for Birmingham City to defeat Charlton Athletic. Jay Stansfield scored the only goal of the game as Birmingham City beat Charlton Athletic

arts.ttl: Nathan Jones: Charlton Athletic lacked spark during defeat at Birmingham City
arts.sum: It’s the third game in a week and we just lacked a little bit of bite. It just showed today that we were probably lacking a little bit of spark because we’ve been excellent but today we just weren’t and we needed to be at our best today.

arts.ttl: Jay Stansfield fires leaders Birmingham past Charlton at St Andrew’s
Chris Davies opens up on Alfie May axe as Jay Stansfield takes the lead for Birmingham City
arts.sum: Chris Davies has empathised with Alfie May after dropping the Birmingham City striker in favour of a free-scoring Jay Stansfield. “From Alfie’s point of view, he scored a couple of really good goals against Wigan that set us up well in the league, then I made a couple of changes for the cup games, bits and bobs, and as it’s all panned out he’s played the Wrexham game but he’s not been starting games,” said Davies.

arts.ttl: I couldn’t walk into my local when I played for Birmingham City - I would have got shot - Birmingham Live
arts.sum: Geoff Horsfield recounts his experiences playing for Birmingham City in Second City derbies against Aston Villa Geoff Horsfield claims he couldn’t set foot in his local pub when he played for Birmingham City through fear of getting shot.

arts.ttl: Saturday's League One predictions including Birmingham City vs. Charlton Athletic
arts.sum: Sports Mole provides score predictions and previews for all of today's League One fixtures, including Birmingham City vs. Charlton Athletic.
